New Records: Jack Flaherty's eight earned runs matched a postseason record accomplished by 15 other pitchers in history.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the first inning.
Andy Pages hit two home runs for the Dodgers.
Ryne Stanek tossed a career-high 2 1/3 innings.
Edwin Díaz got the last six outs to secure the victory for the Mets.
Starling Marte went 4-for-4 with three doubles.
Francisco Lindor tripled home a run.
Brandon Nimmo brought Flaherty’s tally to eight runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza observed strong preparation and positive attitudes in the hitters' meeting.
The Mets' offense was expected to be explosive due to the depth of their lineup.
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza highlighted the team's preparation and determination to keep their season alive.
